safety_edibility_notes: Protected species in most jurisdictions. Historically hunted by some Arctic indigenous peoples for subsistence. High trophic level leads to bioaccumulation of pollutants including PCBs and mercury.
safety_warning_text: Wild orcas are powerful apex predators capable of causing fatal injuries. No confirmed unprovoked fatal attacks on humans in the wild, but captive incidents have occurred.
safety_summary: While wild orcas have not been documented killing humans, they are powerful apex predators deserving respect. Maintain safe distances when observing in the wild.
safety_contraindications: Maintain minimum distances as required by regulations
Avoid areas where orcas are hunting
encounter_protocol: Observe from vessels at regulated distances (typically 100+ meters). Do not pursue or encircle pods.
legal_protection_status: Protected under MMPA (USA), CITES Appendix II
